channel.title: A virus that's undeletable (An alert to watch out for)
channel.description:
Not too long ago, my uncle emailed a bunch of people saying Microsoft just discovered a new virus that can't be deleted yet. It can steal any info from you, and just mess your computer up. They said it was recieved by an email, hotmail, etc... And the title is "Life is Beautiful" With an attached file. DO NOT OPEN IT!!!! It holds the one virus that can't be deleted. So keep an eye out for it, and immediately delete it.
Send this to everyone you care for, or notify them of it!
~Lin

item.title: A virus that's undeletable (An alert to watch out for)
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

lol well i had a few viruses that i thought were un removeable, they linked themselves to winlogon and explorer.exe, so if i was booted i windows, i couldn’t delete them… explorer one was easy to get rid of, winlogon one i had to get a special program to edit eveything, change my regestry about 50 times, and a bunch of other stuff before i could remove it

Read full topic
item.source: A virus that's undeletable (An alert to watch out for)

item.title: A virus that's undeletable (An alert to watch out for)
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Hmm… Old? Hoax? That sucks, I guess I just spammed Curse my uncle… >.<

Feel free to delete then, I guess. But I’ll quote my Uncle’s email.

***** I M P O R T A N T W A R N I NG *****

Anyone-using Internet mail such as Yahoo, Hotmail, AOL, and so on.
This information arrived this morning, Direct from both Microsoft and
Norton.
Please send it to everybody you know who has access to the Internet.

You may receive an apparently harmless e-mail with a Power Point
presentation “Life is Beautiful”. If you receive it DO NOT OPEN THE
FILE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, and delete it immediately.
If you open this file, a message will appear on your screen saying
“It is too late now; your life is no longer beautiful.”
Subsequently you will LOSE EVERYTHING IN YOUR PC, and the person who
sent it to you will gain access to your name, e-mail, and password.
This is a new virus which started to circulate on Saturday after-noon.
AOL has already confirmed the severity and the anti-virus software’s
are not capable of destroying it.
The virus has been created by a hacker who calls himself “lifeowner”.

PLEASE SEND A COPY OF THIS E-MAIL TO ALL YOUR FRIENDS and ask them to
PASS IT ON IMMEDIATELY!

THIS HAS BEEN CONFIRMED BY SNOPES.
EVEN IF IT IS A HOAX, BETTER SAFE THAN SORRY!

:mad:

Read full topic
item.source: A virus that's undeletable (An alert to watch out for)

item.title: A virus that's undeletable (An alert to watch out for)
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Old…and fake

http://www.snopes.com/computer/virus/life.asp
http://us.mcafee.com/virusInfo/default.asp?id=description&virus_k=99307

Anything as old as the virus you mentioned (if it were real) would be covered by the latest virus definitions. But the McAfee Threat Center is a good place to find info about the latest and most dangerous bugs: http://www.mcafee.com/us/threat_center/default.asp

Read full topic
